name: Rimonim Eilat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The trip to Eilat was supposed to be the highlight of our vacation in Israel and turned out to be a disaster.
reviews.title: A disastrous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had travelled to this hotel in July 2010 - and since I have had a great time, we had decided to book three days in this hotel. The receptionist was friendly, but wanted my credit card - although the room was paid in advance by my credit card, which he didn't believe. Only after telling him two times he could see that we have paid already (which was a mistake!).
reviews.title: Fantastic breakfast, updated rooms, hotel staff,excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The first thing we saw, when we entered then our room was the open door of the small fridge - so it was covered in ice. But despite that, the room was dirty as if it was not cleaned for weeks or even months. Dust was on the shelves, the leather of the chair was broken, there was an old chewing gum package and other "leftovers" behind the flat screen TV...
reviews.title: Another great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: We called the reception and the manager Shmulik came to our room and promised, everything will be fixed, when we come back from the pool.
reviews.title: I was very disappointed with the room, as it was not clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my title might already suggest - nothing was fixed when we came back, except that the fridge had been changed.
reviews.title: WOW, what a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friends and I spent two nites at the Rimonim and it was great. The hotel has recently been remodeled. (formerly the Neptune). The lobby screams "boutique hotel" . Everything from the reception desk, to the comfortable groupings of furniture in the lobby, the bar and the restaurant screams new, fresh, updated. The front desk is staffed with lovely, personable, helpful employees. They were able to provide great service and concerge information too. And they were just terrific. The rooms. I loved mine #319. Faced the Red Sea. The tile floors are so much better then carpet found at other hotels. Makes it so much cleaner. The room has great colors, accessories and appointments. Entertaiment in the lobby. People were dancing there both nites I was there. Breakfast was included and was a buffet with so many stations it would be impossible not to find something to eat. Overall excellant and I wll return.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed my stay at the Rimonim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean & bright!
reviews.title: Very nice!! Clean and bright - lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern decor!
reviews.title: It is 3* rather than 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice rooms with excellent views.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lovely pool very close to the beach.
reviews.title: Good family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff are extremely helpful and polite unlike some of the guests who do not understand taking your turn in a queue. The rooms are fairly basic but all have see view balconies and air conditioning. Room service is a bit of a joke in that the bed is just pulled up but no more and the bathroom was cleaned but bins were not always emptied! The pool is a good size and caters for all ages with plenty of sun loungers available and towels can be collected by the pool. The pool cafe serves generous portions and try hard to please. We did not use the health spa but it is well equipped and managed.
reviews.title: Prime location and a breakfast that surpasses all expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The real treat was breakfast - it is outstanding! The choice is unbelievable from pancakes with maple syrup through to smoked salmon, it is all there and plenty of it. Not a breakfast to be rushed and well worth getting in early and grazing through all the choice available. Combined with a relaxed atmosphere this really helps set you up for the day.
reviews.title: Second time after 3 years...still, one of the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would go back just for the breakfast! The hotel is situated in a perfect location right in the heart of the city, shopping malls a two minute walk away, beach right in front of the hotel and lots of restaurants etc along the sea front.
reviews.title: Great hotel, rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the service.
reviews.title: The Rimonim, Eilat. (Not to be confused with the Rimonim Central Park).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the reception clerk,threw the restuarant waiters, to the maintenance man, all of them make you feel like VIP.
reviews.title: Great location and excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel advertises itself as a 5 star hotel which it definitely is not. 3.5 starts tops. Decor was tacky, room was not the cleanest. Peeling paint, dusty surfaces , scratched mirror, a crooked lamp, and bed sheets which could have been cleaner. View was nice but bad paint job on balcony ruined part of the experience. Food was great though but the service during the meals was terrible. I had to ask for coffee 3 times and then ended up helping myself. Lots of kids so don't expect a relaxing experience. Front desk was helpful. Hotel needs to be renovated and much more attention must be put into making sure the rooms are completely clean and furniture is in good condition. Wouldn't recommend this place until you can't afford the more expensive ones.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here on our tour. The rooms were fine and all had a lovely view of the Red Sea. Free internet in the lobby was limited to one hour and it was not always that easy to get on.The pool is lovely and the back exit takes on directly on the boardwalk which is quite and experience to walk on. Keep walking to the bridge and one will find better stores and restaurants. A hint if one goes out the front of the hotel and walks left you will find nice restaurants and come to the boardwalk faster.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We booked 15 rooms for our group and everyone was happy with their room. The rooms are small but comfortable. There were no complaints about cleanliness and my room was spotlessly clean and fresh. The food in this hotel is excellent. Lots of choices and many items in a meze style. The location is very central in the tourist area with everything you need just steps from the hotel. This is not a luxury hotel but it is upscale, comfortable and a good price in comparison to others. I would definitely recommend it especially for families and older people.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent an entire week at the Rimonim - very clean (the most important feature), decent beds, great food, and excellent service. The gym was very disappointing, but other than that we enjoyed the hotel and staff very much. I highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: So we just got back from a 3 day 3 night stay here with some friends. First of all the food was amazing. Seriously I never had such a great breakfast. You name it they had it!! Take your time and enjoy all the different kinds of things. They are kosher which was great cause I never had to worry about mixing things :)
reviews.title: Amazing place! Great vacation!!

description: On the shores of the Red Sea, in the tourist and entertainment area of Eilat, stands the Rimonim Neptune Hotel, recently totally renovated. This classic hotel, known for high standards of service and warm hospitality, provides its guests with 278 modern rooms, overlooking the beautiful Eilat Bay. Other facilities include a well-equipped Health Club, intimate lobby-bar including wireless internet connection, large outdoor pool, children and kiddies pools and an array of activities and attractions.
